column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=On the media and Iraq
#Text=DS : What do you think is the reason there is this collective idea to give Americans a certain view of a place or a people that is not necessarily accurate ?
#Text=I think Iran is another good example , where we are consistently fed images and notions about a people and a culture that are n't really accurate .
#Text=GT :
#Text=Or fair minded .
#Text=DS : Or fair minded .
#Text=But the reality is far more interesting than the same stories we are consistently fed .
#Text=GT :
#Text=Well it involves more work .
#Text=I think most journalists are pretty lazy , number one .
#Text=A little lazy and also they 're spoon-fed information , such as the weapons of mass destruction back in 2003 .
#Text=It 's easy .
#Text=There are all these lobbyist groups , these special interest groups .
#Text=Each of them has a position with regard to Taiwan , for example .
#Text=The anti-China lobby is very strong .

#Text=Whether it 's the gun lobby or the Israeli lobby or the Taiwan lobby , whatever the hell it is , you have these people who create a package of news , develop it as a story line , a scenario , and they find , as Mailer once said about the press , that they 're like a donkey .
#Text=You have to feed the donkey .
#Text=The donkey every day has to eat .
#Text=So these people throw information at this damn animal that eats everything .
#Text=Tin cans , garbage .
#Text=DS : And Americans are the donkeys as well ?
#Text=GT :
#Text=Well the media ... .
#Text=DS :
#Text=But people are still consuming what they 're throwing out there though .
#Text=GT :
#Text=Yeah , they are , because they 're getting stories .
#Text=In Iraq the whole press is embedded .
#Text=Those correspondents who drive around in tanks and armored personnel carriers , who are spoon-fed what the military gives them and they become mascots for the military , these journalists .
#Text=I would n't have journalists embedded if I had any power ! You said what would you do ?
#Text=Well there are stories to be done .
#Text=There are a lot of stories to be done .
#Text=You do n't have to have military protection .
#Text=There are stories you can do that are n't done .
#Text=I 've said that many times .
#Text=What story would you do ?
#Text=Well even if you 're stuck in the Green Zone you can do stories .
#Text=DS : It 's dangerous to actually go out there and hit the pavement .
#Text=GT :
#Text=Supposed you do n't have to go out there ?
#Text=There are stories to be done in the Green Zone , within whatever the walls of protection are .
#Text=You could do stories about Iraqis who work within the Green Zone .
#Text=You could do stories about what kind of sexual activity goes on .
#Text=Back to sex now .
#Text=Here 's what 's important :

#Text=In times of occupation of every historical event involving the United States , whether it 's World War II , whether it 's the war in Vietnam , Korea , occupation of Japan after World War II , World War I , there 's always been a private relationship with the people of the country that 's been invaded .
#Text=Always .
